While this game has its ups and downs (weird balance changes,unwise executive decisions and all that), it's still incredibly fun to play. Some will compare it to tf2 however, the more competitive nature and the constantly changing meta result in this game being a far different experience from the chaotic 12v12 (no one plays comp don't bring it up) nature of tf2. Regardless, i'd probably rate this game a 7/10, certainly needs some changes stat but other than that it's quite enjoyable

Overwatch 1 was WAY more fun than this.

We had free events almost every season when this game was released, and I get it that the company wanted to make more money, but releasing the same quality as the content that once were free is a nasty tactic. I get it that you want to sell this as a "new game mode" but it isn't new at all. A fancy menu to interact with PvE missions doesn't worth the price you charge. 

Stick to Team Fortress 2, ppl.
man at this point I don't even care for a refund I just want the 7 years of my lifespan I spent playing this game back
They should add the older skins and sell them for $20 each

I have plenty of more hours outside of Steam. This game is really fun. I mean, sure, 1 was a better game, but 2 is still good. Its just a matter of getting into its metagame and everything. Do I prefer 6 to 5 player teams? Of course.

Gameplay is really good. I prefer it over TF2. This game is more satisfying to play, all the characters are fun in their own way. I would describe this game as basically being a lot like Super Smash Bros. and TF2 if they had a baby. I mean, you got cool unique characters, all with cool powers and abilities, and they have ultimates, which work like final smashes. This is a game where your main chooses you, so you actually feel more invested into playing more than a single character.

Graphics are pretty. I love the artstyle. Its so iconic, and the animation techniques are definitely smart and well animated. 

The music is good too, some tracks are even totally orchestrated and shed a tear in my eye, like the anniversary main menu theme. However some tracks are pretty bland. On top of its sound, the sound design IS really good. The kill and hit sounds are some of the most satisfying and iconic noises in gaming. Hearing the elimination noises for killing opponents really is ear satisfaction. It adds so much emphasis to the gameplay!

The lore is ok. Some stuff is unique, but really none of it is justified at all. Omnics aren't people, Talon sucks, and so is team Overwatch. Really, all three parties are immoral.

Now, besides the gameplay itself, yeah it has some cringe and disgustingness. I won't really give context to what they are, but you might know what I am referring to. 

Also with being out all the time now, its nice to have the game on the go while on my breaks from work. So yeah, really good game.

è€ƒè¿ªå…‹ç›´æ¥æŠŠä½ å¦ˆæŒ‰åœ¨ä½ å¦ˆç…é”…ä¸ŠæŒ¤ä¸Šä½ å¦ˆé€¼ä½ çˆ¸çˆ¸çš„ç²¾æ¶²ä½“å–‚ç»™ä½ åƒï¼ï¼

Pros:
Free to play
Probably one of, if not,  the best team based PvP games on the market right now, in terms of gameplay.
Developers are very quick to balance characters compared to other games, resulting in a quickly shifting meta.
Large hero variety, even between the 3 major classes. This allows for the player to pick what characters they want to play.
(More opinionated on this one but) no other game has managed to capture the feel of Overwatch, its special and unique.

Cons:
Awful community, one of the worst I have ever seen. They hate their fellow players, the game, and the company, even when they do make good decisions
Marketing. Every other season, a new hero gets released and gets put behind a SOFT paywall, making players have to buy the season pass to unlock the character instantly OR grind a decent amount in the battle pass to unlock the character for free. And if you didn't own overwatch 1, you also have to grind to unlock most of the base game heros.
Blizzard: Very controversial past, even though they have dealt with issues, more seem to crop up out of nowhere. Under delivered after year(s) of silence on the PVE mode.

Overall, I do recomend this game if you want a very good and unique PvP experience, but only if you don't mind ignoring the community telling you to hate everything about this game. It is understandable if one does not like the game because of the company, too.

Great game but Blizzard is the worst developer ever.

Amazing game with amazing characters and lore. The rule 34 content is what keeps this game relevant. On top of that, Blizzard is just a money grubbing, capitalistic, no shame company that just wants to milk the last dollar out of all of our wallets. Whether you play for nostalgia or just casually, Blizzard has one motive to keep this game running and it's just to take advantage of the community with false promises while forcing microtransactions down our throats. Also, Blizzard released OW2 on my birthday on Steam so thanks for making me look bad.
Looking for Group was the best part about this game and they removed that
